title: the reason why mobile champions are more "fun" is because there are fewer consequences for errors
body: the best example I can think of is if Zed uses his W incorrectly he still has flash to get out of situations and vice versa if he uses flash incorrectly he still has his W to rely on. Flash on immobile champions is solely used to escape death (theoretically - I've seen some of you boosted animals out there). Keeping that in mind, immobile champions are punished harder than mobile ones and the repercussions are evident (snowball, cs lead, pressure etc.). With mobile champions you can get to lane faster, are less susceptible to ganks, and can roam easily. In some cases mobile champions mobile abilities are used to clear waves (fizz E, LB W) and they're pretty good at it. My complaint is that it is more rewarding to play sloppy on a mobile champion than near perfect on an immobile one

Champions that are immobile generally have strong range so they can fullfill their role safely from outside the enemies threat range {{champion:99}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:22}} not that these champioms arent vulnerable they very susceptible to being rushed on, thats just their strength

Try playing zed or fizz against a fed {{champion:117}} with a {{champion:117}} and {{champion:57}} next to them, its not as forgiving as youd think
The problem with thta in League is that some mobile champions have such great mobility that the range difference doesn't even matter at that point.

Which is when you need to take other factors into consideration.

For example, which is better in a 1v1, zed or lux? Obviously zed, because his mobility allows him to close in to pump out his massive damage easily.

Now, which is better in a 5v5 team fight? In this case, lux, since she can spam spells with nigh impunity, assuming she has a somewhat balanced team comp that can protect her from the mobile champs.
Which would work, if teamfights were more relevant and the game wasn't practically over before they started.

Which is a well known problem atm.

Hence, the only reason mobility feels super overbearing is because it excels in the current game state, where games are decided before team fights become relevant.

So instead of complaining about mobile champs, we should be focused on changing the pacing of the game

If I may: I actually think tank metas are the most "fun" for most people here because there's little-to-no consequence in a tank meta. 

For your example, sloppy play often request the use of an instant, burned resource. There's a reason junglers will spam-ping Flash because it means it'll be on CD for the foreseeable future, removing a valuable tool. Not always the case, yes, but often that loss of a resource can be crippling and make champions (in an ideal situation) double check their surroundings. Also in high damage metas like this, defensive play requires split-second timing or you get burst, meaning mobility actually matters less here as squeamishness is a bigger detriment than lacking mobility.

Tank metas with long teamfights not only allow this in spades but sometimes are long enough that you can get off multiple uses of a rotation you miss. It also means there's less consequence to poor positioning/play because you'll survive longer and be able to avoid death. Tank metas are, in the end, the most sloppy and forgiving meta. Damage is low. Durability is high and even the strongest tankbuster will take some time to chew through a tough target.
